body.p:
Camp 11" Ky Vol Cavly
Camp Nelson Ky
January 9th 1865
Thos E Bramlett
Gov of Kentucky

Sir, We beg leave to petition your Excellency to commission Maj Frederick Slater to the vacant Lieut Colonelcy of this Regiment occasioned by the death of Lieut Col Wm O Boyle, And also Capt Joseph Lawson to the vacant Majority occasioned by the promotion of Maj Slater, If any other persons have been commissioned, we earnestly beseech you to have their commissions revoked and commission Maj Slater & Capt Lawson as aforesaid, for the following reasons,

1st Because of their superior qualifications
2nd Because they have always bore the part of brave & skillful officers in every fight & skirmish in which they have been engaged,
3rd Because their promotion will give almost universal satisfaction in the Regt boath among the officers & men, and Render the Regiment more efficient, than it would be by the promotion of any other persons to said positions.
4th Because we understand that
Col M Graham who is sick in Hsptl at Louisville has or is about to offer his resignation and on that account will probably not recommend any one for either of these positions,
We have not the least doubt but that these recommendations meet his -- the Colns -- hearty approval

We are Your
Very Humbl & Obt Servts

Wm P Pierce Capt Co "A"
H F Davis Lt Comdg Co F
Solomon Huffman Lt Com Co E
John J Rose Luiet Co (C)
A W Stone Lieut Co B
Harry Gee Adjt 11 Ky Cav
Lt Jos Willemin Co. G.
Lt S W Wade Co. G.

Camp 11" Ky Cavy.
Camp Nelson Ky
Jany 9" 1865
Pierce Wm P.
Capt. Co. A. & others-
To The Gov
Ask that Maj: Fredk. Slater be commissioned Ly Col 11" Ky Cav. vice W. O Boyle decd & Capt Joseph Lawson be comsd Maj. vice Slater promoted.
Recd A. G. O. Ky 10 Jany 1865
